title: Private employers cut 32K jobs last month — hiking odds of interest rate cut as Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick goes on defensive
description: Private payrolls lost 32,000 jobs last month – a sharp downward turn from an upwardly revised increase of 47,000 in October, according to the ADP National Employment Report on Wednesday.
content: Odds of an interest-rate cut at the Feds meeting next week jumped in the wake of disappointing November private payroll figures, with Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick arguing President Trump’s tarif… [+4990 chars]
